ARABIC: فَقَرَأَهُۥ عَلَيْهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ مُؤْمِنِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: who had then recited it to them, they still would not have iman in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And he had recited it to them, and they had not believed (it would have been different).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: they would still not have believed in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: who would have read it to them, they (pagans) would not have believed in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: In order that he read it to them, even then they would not have believed in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And he had recited it unto them, they would not have believed in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So that he should have recited it to them, they would not have believed therein.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and he had recited it to them, they would not have believed in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And he had read it unto them, they would not have believed in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and he had recited it to them, they would not have believed in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And he had-read it unto them, even then they would not have been believers therein.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and had he recited it to them, they would not have believed in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And had he recited it to them, they would not have believed in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And he had recited it unto them, they would not have believed in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and he had recited it to them, they would not have believed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And he had recited it to them, they still would not have believed in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And he had recited it to them [perfectly], they would [still] not have been believers in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:199] and had he recited it to them, that is, [to] the disbelievers of Mecca, they would not have believed in it, disdaining to follow it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And he had read it unto them) unto Quraysh, (they would not have believed in it) i.e. in the Qur'an, because they did not believe in what was in their own language, so how were they to believe in something which is in a different language?
